alert.note: Alert for Kenosha; Racine; Walworth (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Walworth, western Racine and western Kenosha Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 644 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harvard, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elkhorn, Delavan, Lake Geneva, East Troy, Williams Bay, Wind Lake, Twin Lakes, Rochester, Wheatland, Genoa City, Walworth, Fontana-On-Geneva Lake, Powers Lake, Browns Lake, Como, Waterford North, Pell Lake, Potter Lake, Eagle Lake and Bohners Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for southeastern Wisconsin.
